overview_of_class: Japanese I (JAPANESE 111-1, 2 and 3) is a yearlong course that covers the first half of college level elementary Japanese.  In Japanese I, students will develop the four skills of speaking, listening, reading, and writing and learn many aspects of Japanese culture and society through various in-class activities, written assignments, and video viewing.  Students will also learn to identify and self-correct errors in their language use to become independent learners. The instructor will assist in this learning process with oral and written feedback. Careful and thorough review and preparation for each class session are required.
name: Japanese I
class_attributes:
Prerequisites apply, see description

Specific requirements in the language
subject: JAPANESE
